thread.title: Heroin deal gone bad results in assault, arrests, officials say
thread.title_full: Heroin deal gone bad results in assault, arrests, officials say | OregonLive.com

author: Luke Hammill | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Heroin deal gone bad results in assault, arrests, officials say
text:
Jacob Michael Sones Yamhill County Sheriff's Office Two Sheridan men were arrested Friday after they agreed to sell a man heroin and then tried to assault and rob him, the Yamhill County Sheriff's Office announced.
Jacob Michael Sones, 26, and Mark Godon Chaney, 27, are both being held in lieu of $167,500 bail.
Sones and Chaney met the victim in a local tavern, deputies said, and agreed to sell him heroin. They left for a home on Northwest Yamhill Street to finish the deal, officials said.
In the backyard, Sones and Chaney allegedly tried to rob the victim, taking him to the ground, punching him and choking him, authorities said.
The victim called for help and neighbors dialed 911, deputies said.
Mark Godon Chaney Yamhill County Sheriff's Office Chaney was charged with robbery, assault, strangulation and possession of a restricted weapon by a felon, officials said. The weapons charge resulted from a stun gun, authorities said.
Sones was charged with robbery, assault and possession of heroin.
-- Luke Hammill
